name: portachrom production | portachrom | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/311/documentation

The dataset represents the production of 1 kg of portachrom from chromium containing concentrate following benefication process.;Land-use is an approximation based on iron ore extraction. Material and energy inputs, industrial machine, and particulate emissions are an approximation based on iron mining and limestone crushing and milling.;[This dataset was already contained in the ecoinvent database version 2. It was not individually updated during the transfer to ecoinvent version 3. Life Cycle Impact Assessment results may still have changed, as they are affected by changes in the supply chain, i.e. in other datasets. This dataset was generated following the ecoinvent quality guidelines for version 2. It may have been subject to central changes described in the ecoinvent version 3 change report (http://www.ecoinvent.org/database/ecoinvent-version-3/reports-of-changes/), and the results of the central updates were reviewed extensively. The changes added e.g. consistent water flows and other information throughout the database. The documentation of this dataset can be found in the ecoinvent reports of version 2, which are still available via the ecoinvent website. The change report linked above covers all central changes that were made during the conversion process.]

From the reception of chromium containing concentrate following benefication process.

This activity ends with the production of 1 kg of portachrom. The dataset includes raw materials, machineries and energy consumption for production, estimated emissions to air from production and infrastructure of the site. The dataset doesn't include water emissions, overburden and tailing material from process, and losses of product.
category: B:Mining and quarrying/07:Mining of metal ores/072:Mining of non-ferrous metal ores/0729:Mining of other non-ferrous metal ores

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Data are used here as European average.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: The mining and following benefication process of chromite results in a 44.9% chromium containing concentrate. The technology is based on iron production. No further chemical treatment is considered, just a production of a fine powder of this concentrate based on limestone crushing and milling technology. It is assumed an overall yield for chromite of 95%.

exchanges.description:
Portachrom is a brand name for chromite and is used for producing brilliant green glass. Chromite is a mixture that can be described as (Fe2+,Mg)O.(Cr,Al, Fe3+)2O3 and contains only in exceptional cases more than 50% of Cr2O3.
EcoSpold01Location=RER
